File which controls how SDL_Config library will be compiled.

Summary
File which controls how SDL_Config library will be compiled.
Macros
CFG_USE_DEFAULT_VALUES
It controls what version of function definitions will be compiled: those with or without default values.
CFG_BUILD_STATIC_LIB
Defines that library will be build as static lib.
CFG_BUILD_DLL
Defines that library will be build as dynamically linked library.
CFG_PROFILE_LIB
If enabled, then library will generate to stdout how much miliseconds it took to Open/Save files.
CFG_REMOVE_GROUP_SPACES
If enabled, spaces from within group declarations will be removed, otherwise they will stay untouched, ie.
CFG_USE_BOOL
If not defined, functions that operate on bools will be changed to int.
CFG_DEBUG_LIB
If defined, library will be sending debugging output to stderr.
CFG_ASSERT_NULL_ENABLED
When defined, if the pointer to currently selected file equals 0 at any point where it would cause mysterious SEGFAULTS etc.

Macros

CFG_USE_DEFAULT_VALUES

It controls what version of function definitions will be compiled: those with or without default values.  Obviously, default values are supported and can be used only in C++.

Normally you don’t have to change it, since library automatically detects whether you’re compiling with C++ or C etc.



CFG_BUILD_STATIC_LIB
Defines that library will be build as static lib.
By default, defined.



CFG_BUILD_DLL
Defines that library will be build as dynamically linked library.
Currently not supported.



CFG_PROFILE_LIB
If enabled, then library will generate to stdout how much miliseconds it took to Open/Save files.  Beware that you must call SDL_Init(SDL_INIT_TIMER) before calling any library functions and SDL_Quit() at end of program if you are using this functionality.
By default, not defined.



CFG_REMOVE_GROUP_SPACES
If enabled, spaces from within group declarations will be removed, otherwise they will stay untouched, ie.
[ my_group ] // if CFG_REMOVE_GROUP_SPACES defined, you will get "my_group"
[ my_group ] // if CFG_REMOVE_GROUP_SPACES not defined, you will get " my_group "
By default, defined.



CFG_USE_BOOL
If not defined, functions that operate on bools will be changed to int.  Native bool support is maintained for people using C++.
It is assumed that if you are compiling in C++, you want to use bool, and in this way those defintions are constructed.  However, you may choose to use int instead - just comment that one definition inside.



CFG_DEBUG_LIB
If defined, library will be sending debugging output to stderr.
By default, it’s not defined.



CFG_ASSERT_NULL_ENABLED
When defined, if the pointer to currently selected file equals 0 at any point where it would cause mysterious SEGFAULTS etc. this will happen: to sderr.txt will be outputted such an information:
Application which uses SDL_Config library (version: %VERSION) has created
an errorneus situation: pointer to selected file is equal to NULL (0) at
%LINE line of file %FILE, so that function %FUNCTION can't continue.
Also, application will be immediately terminated through calling assembler interrupt 3.
By default, it’s not defined.
Note
If __FUNCTION__ macro isn’t supported by your compiler, you may run into errors when compiling library with CFG_ASSERT_NULL_ENABLED.  However, it should be supported by all modern compilers (ie.  GCC, VisualC++).
